com.sixtyfourbitsperminute.crushhour
Class Parser

java.lang.Object
  com.sixtyfourbitsperminute.crushhour.Parser

public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Jonathan Thompson, Kelly Croswell This method parses a String of text that represents a grid and turns it into a Grid object if the grid is valid.

Field Summary
(package private)  char[][] grid
          A two dimensional array of chars containing the fully separated grid.
(package private)  java.lang.String[] gridLines
          An array of Strings containing each separated line of the grid.
(package private)  int gridSize
          An int containing the length of the grid.
(package private)  java.lang.String gridString
          A String containing the unparsed grid.
(package private)  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,Vehicle> vehicleMap
          A HashMap containing the list of potential vehicles on the grid.

Constructor Detail

Parser

public Parser(java.lang.String gridString)
This is the constructor for this class which takes in a String containing a potenial grid and sets it on a global variable.

Parameters:
gridString - A string containing the unparsed grid.
Method Detail

isSquareGrid

public boolean isSquareGrid()
This method returns whether or not the grid is square because only square grids are valid in this version of the game.

Returns:
A boolean containing whether or not the grid is square.

readStringInto2DArray

public void readStringInto2DArray()
This method reads the previously lines of the grid into a two dimensional char array, in the global variables.

allVehiclesAreLegal

public boolean allVehiclesAreLegal()
This method checks through every character in the grid to see if it is a non "empty space" character, then checks to see if that character is attached to a legal car or truck, then checks to ensure that the vehicle is not repeated anywhere else on the grid. If, at any point, one of these conditions is false the method returns false, causing the parse to return false, meaning the potential grid is invalid.

Returns:
A boolean containing whether or not all of the potential vehicles are legal.

getDirection

public boolean getDirection(char current,
                            char[] neighbors)
This method returns whether the vehicle in question is horizontally placed or vertically placed on the grid. Returning true is horizontal, false is vertical.

Parameters:
current - The character representation of the current vehicle.
neighbors - The characters immediately surrounding the current char.
Returns:
A boolean containing the vehicle's orientation.

isTruck

public boolean isTruck(char current,
                       char[] neighbors,
                       int[] position)
This method checks to see if the current character in the grid is part of a truck on the grid, and whether or not it has a duplicate somewhere.

Parameters:
current - The current character in the grid.
neighbors - The characters immediately surrounding the current character.
position - The position that the current character is at in the array.
Returns:
A boolean containing whether or not the character is part of a truck.

isCar

public boolean isCar(char current,
                     char[] neighbors,
                     int[] position)
This method checks to see if the current character in the grid is part of a car on the grid, and whether or not it has a duplicate somewhere.

Parameters:
current - The current character in the grid.
neighbors - The characters immediately surrounding the current character.
position - The position that the current character is at in the array.
Returns:
A boolean containing whether or not the character is part of a car.

letterExistsElsewhere

public boolean letterExistsElsewhere(char current,
                                     int[] positionOne,
                                     int[] positionTwo,
                                     int[] positionThree)
This method checks to see if the current character exists anywhere else in the grid except the locations that are part of the potenial vehicle. If the character does occur elsewhere, then the vehicle is not legal, the grid is invalid, and the method returns false.

Parameters:
current - The current character in the grid.
positionOne - The position that the current character is in on the grid.
positionTwo - The position of a neighboring character that is part of a potential car or truck.
positionThree - The position of a neighboring character that is part of a potential truck.
Returns:
A boolean containing whether or not the character exists somewhere else in the grid.

readInNeighbors

public char[] readInNeighbors(char[] neighbors,
                              int row,
                              int column)
This method takes an array of characters set to question marks and fills it, where they exist, with the neighboring characters of the current grid position.

Parameters:
neighbors - The array of characters that are neighbors to the current position.
row - An int holding the current row of the position.
column - An int holding the current column of the position.
Returns:
An array containing the neighbors of the current position.

addVehicleToMap

public void addVehicleToMap(char current,
                            boolean direction,
                            int[] position,
                            int length)
This method adds the newly found vehicle on the grid to the list of vehicles that have already been found, if it has not already been added.

Parameters:
current - The current character in the grid.
direction - The orientation of the newly found vehicle.
position - The position of the newly found vehicle.
length - The length of the newly found vehicle.

findUserCar

public Vehicle findUserCar()
This method returns the "user" car, or the car that must be escaped from the grid.

Returns:
A Vehicle containing the User Car.

gridHasUserCar

public boolean gridHasUserCar()
This method checks to ensure that the potential grid has a "user" car, or the car that must be escaped from the grid. If the grid does nto contain a User Car, the method returns false and the grid is invalid.

Returns:
A boolean containing whether or not a User Car exists.

fileCanCreateGrid

public boolean fileCanCreateGrid()
This method systemically checks through the grid, using the other methods in the class, to ensure that the potential grid can greate a valid, legal Grid object. If any of the previous methods fail, this method fails and the grid is invalid.

Returns:
A boolean containing the validity of the potential grid.

createGrid

public Grid createGrid()
This method checks to ensure that a valid grid can be created and, if it can, it creates the grid.

Returns:
The newly created grid.
